clusters.title: Venezuela Hits Back After Donald Trump Announces Airspace Closure
clusters.neutral_headline: Venezuela Condemns Trump's Airspace Closure as Colonialist Threat
bullet_summary: In a statement, the Venezuelan government said Trump’s comments are a “colonialist threat” against their sovereignty and violate international law
The government also said it demanded respect for its airspace and would not accept foreign orders or threats
Venezuela has accused Donald Trump of making a "colonial threat," after the US president said the airspace "above and surrounding" the country should be considered closed "in its entirety"
President Donald Trump said Saturday morning that Venezuela’s airspace should be considered “closed” as he weighs military action against the South American nation

items.title: Venezuela Hits Back After Donald Trump Announces Airspace Closure
items.standfirst: The U.S. has for months built up its military presence around Venezuela as it carried out a strike campaign on alleged drug boats.
items.content: The U.S. has for months built up its military presence around Venezuela as it carried out a strike campaign on alleged drug boats.

items.title: Venezuela condemns Trump's threat to close country's airspace
items.standfirst: The US says it is fighting drugs smuggling, but Venezuela says Donald Trump's aim is to topple President Nicolás Maduro.
items.content: The US says it is fighting drugs smuggling, but Venezuela says Donald Trump's aim is to topple President Nicolás Maduro.

items.title: Venezuela Condemns Trump Airspace Closure As 'Colonialist Threat,' Senate Democrats Raise War Powers Concerns

items.standfirst: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his team have repeatedly tried to contact the White House after United States leader Donald Trump imposed a blockade on the South American country's airspace, C...
items.content: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his team have repeatedly tried to contact the White House after United States leader Donald Trump imposed a blockade on the South American country's airspace, C...

items.title: Trump declares Venezuela's airspace closed
items.standfirst: President Trump intensified his pressure campaign on Venezuela on Saturday. He posted that the airspace around the country is "closed in its entirety." Weijia Jiang has more details.
items.content: President Trump intensified his pressure campaign on Venezuela on Saturday. He posted that the airspace around the country is "closed in its entirety." Weijia Jiang has more details.

items.title: Venezuela denounces ‘colonialist threat’ as Trump orders airspace closed
items.standfirst: President made declaration in a social media post, after FAA last week warned airlines of ‘worsening security situation’The Venezuelan government has responded defiantly to the heightened pressure by the US government, including Donald Trump’s recent statements on Saturday that the airspace above and surrounding Venezuela is to be closed in its entirety.In a statement, the Venezuelan government said Trump’s comments are a “colonialist threat” against their sovereignty and violate international law. The government also said it demanded respect for its airspace and would not accept foreign orders or threats. Continue reading...
items.content: President made declaration in a social media post, after FAA last week warned airlines of ‘worsening security situation’The Venezuelan government has responded defiantly to the heightened pressure by the US government, including Donald Trump’s recent statements on Saturday that the airspace above and surrounding Venezuela is to be closed in its entirety.In a statement, the Venezuelan government said Trump’s comments are a “colonialist threat” against their sovereignty and violate international law. The government also said it demanded respect for its airspace and would not accept foreign orders or threats. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says Venezuela airspace should be considered closed, Caracas slams 'colonialist threat'
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump on Saturday warned that the airspace above and around Venezuela should be considered closed, escalating tensions with Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro as Washington steps up a major military deployment in the Caribbean and strikes on alleged drug-smuggling vessels. Caracas slammed the warning as a "colonialist threat".
items.content: President Donald Trump on Saturday warned that the airspace above and around Venezuela should be considered closed, escalating tensions with Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro as Washington steps up a major military deployment in the Caribbean and strikes on alleged drug-smuggling vessels. Caracas slammed the warning as a "colonialist threat".

items.title: Venezuela hits out at 'colonial threat' after Trump 'closes' its airspace
items.standfirst: Venezuela has accused Donald Trump of making a "colonial threat," after the US president said the airspace "above and surrounding" the country should be considered closed "in its entirety".
items.content: Venezuela has accused Donald Trump of making a "colonial threat," after the US president said the airspace "above and surrounding" the country should be considered closed "in its entirety".

items.title: Trump tells airlines Venezuela's airspace is 'closed in its entirety' in latest escalation

items.content: President Donald Trump said Saturday morning that Venezuela’s airspace should be considered “closed” as he weighs military action against the South American nation.

ai_summary: Venezuela called Trump's airspace closure a "colonialist threat" against its sovereignty.
The Venezuelan government stated the action violates international law and is unjustified.
President Maduro's team reportedly tried contacting the White House after the closure.
Trump declared Venezuela's airspace closed in its entirety via social media.
The FAA previously warned airlines about a worsening security situation in Venezuela.

clusters.title: Oscar-winning British playwright Tom Stoppard dies aged 88
clusters.neutral_headline: Acclaimed Playwright Tom Stoppard Dies at Age 88
bullet_summary: British playwright Tom Stoppard, who won an Oscar for the screenplay of the 1998 film "Shakespeare In Love", has died at the age of 88, United Agents announced on Saturday
Reported by France24, CBS News, Al Jazeera and others

items.title: Oscar-winning British playwright Tom Stoppard dies aged 88
items.standfirst: British playwright Tom Stoppard, who won an Oscar for the screenplay of the 1998 film "Shakespeare In Love", has died at the age of 88, United Agents announced on Saturday. Stoppard, who first made his name with "Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead" – an absurdist tragicomedy about two minor characters from Shakespeare's "Hamlet" – developed a distinctive style combining serious ideas with comedy.
items.content: British playwright Tom Stoppard, who won an Oscar for the screenplay of the 1998 film "Shakespeare In Love", has died at the age of 88, United Agents announced on Saturday. Stoppard, who first made his name with "Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead" – an absurdist tragicomedy about two minor characters from Shakespeare's "Hamlet" – developed a distinctive style combining serious ideas with comedy.

items.title: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88
items.standfirst: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard has died at 88. Stoppard won the Oscar for his 1998 screenplay "Shakespeare in Love."
items.content: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard has died at 88. Stoppard won the Oscar for his 1998 screenplay "Shakespeare in Love."

items.title: Playwright and "Shakespeare in Love" screenwriter Tom Stoppard dies at 88
items.standfirst: Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation.
items.content: Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation.

items.title: Acclaimed British playwright Tom Stoppard dies aged 88
items.standfirst: British playwright Tom Stoppard, a dramatist who won an Academy Award for the screenplay for 1998's "Shakespeare in Love", has died at the age of 88. Famed for his dazzling wit and depth, Stoppard was credited with reshaping modern theatre, combining intellectual subjects with comedy.
items.content: British playwright Tom Stoppard, a dramatist who won an Academy Award for the screenplay for 1998's "Shakespeare in Love", has died at the age of 88. Famed for his dazzling wit and depth, Stoppard was credited with reshaping modern theatre, combining intellectual subjects with comedy.

items.title: Tom Stoppard, celebrated British playwright, dies aged 88
items.standfirst: Stoppard's writing, often philosophical or scientific but consistently funny, gave rise to the term Stoppardian.
items.content: Stoppard's writing, often philosophical or scientific but consistently funny, gave rise to the term Stoppardian.

items.title: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88
items.standfirst: Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.
items.content: Arcadia, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead and The Coast of Utopia. He's pictured above in London in 2017.'/>Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.(Image credit: Justin Tallis/WPA Pool)

ai_summary: Tom Stoppard, the British playwright, has died at the age of 88.
Stoppard won an Oscar for the screenplay of "Shakespeare in Love" in 1998.
He was known for combining serious ideas with comedy in his work.
Stoppard's writing style is often described as "Stoppardian."
He was considered one of the greatest British playwrights of his generation.

clusters.title: Rubio and Witkoff are meeting with Ukraine's negotiators in Florida as Trump pushes to broker a deal
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Officials Meet with Ukrainian Negotiators in Florida
bullet_summary: A Russian drone attack killed at least one person and wounded 11 in Vyshgorod, outside of Kyiv, the regional governor said Sunday
Russian drone and missile attacks in and around the Ukrainian capital killed at least three people early Saturday, officials said
Russian drone and missile attacks in and around the Ukraine's capital killed at least three people early Saturday, officials said

items.title: Rubio and Witkoff are meeting with Ukraine's negotiators in Florida as Trump pushes to broker a deal
items.standfirst: Top Trump administration officials are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend, pushing to broker an end to Russia's war in Ukraine.
items.content: Top Trump administration officials are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend, pushing to broker an end to Russia's war in Ukraine.(Image credit: Martial Trezzini)

items.title: Trump officials to sit down with Ukrainian negotiators in Florida
items.standfirst: Top Trump administration officials including Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend. The meeting comes after the resignation of Ukraine's top negotiator and chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, due to an anti-graft probe. FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg brings you the latest.
items.content: Top Trump administration officials including Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend. The meeting comes after the resignation of Ukraine's top negotiator and chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, due to an anti-graft probe. FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg brings you the latest.

items.title: Rubio and Witkoff to meet with Ukraine's negotiators in Florida
items.standfirst: Top Trump administration officials are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend, pushing to broker an end to Russia's war in Ukraine and setting the stage for key talks planned this week in Moscow with Russian leader Vladimir Putin, Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, the son-in-law of US President Donald Trump, were expected to sit down with a Ukrainian delegation to further hash out the details of a proposed peace framework.
items.content: Top Trump administration officials are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend, pushing to broker an end to Russia's war in Ukraine and setting the stage for key talks planned this week in Moscow with Russian leader Vladimir Putin, Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, the son-in-law of US President Donald Trump, were expected to sit down with a Ukrainian delegation to further hash out the details of a proposed peace framework.

items.title: Too many cooks? Trump’s growing army of Ukraine negotiators
items.standfirst: With the quartet of Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff, Jared Kushner and Daniel Driscoll, US President Donald Trump’s team of negotiators pushing for peace in Ukraine seems to be growing by the minute. And they are all throwing their own ideas and strategies into the mix. Facing them is Russian President Vladimir Putin's trusted aide Kirill Dmitriev, whose diplomatic one-man show has steadfastly advanced the Kremlin’s demands.
items.content: With the quartet of Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff, Jared Kushner and Daniel Driscoll, US President Donald Trump’s team of negotiators pushing for peace in Ukraine seems to be growing by the minute. And they are all throwing their own ideas and strategies into the mix. Facing them is Russian President Vladimir Putin's trusted aide Kirill Dmitriev, whose diplomatic one-man show has steadfastly advanced the Kremlin’s demands.

items.title: Live: Russian drone strike kills at least one, wounds 11 near Kyiv
items.standfirst: A Russian drone attack killed at least one person and wounded 11 in Vyshgorod, outside of Kyiv, the regional governor said Sunday. The attack came ahead of a meeting between top Trump administration officials and Ukrainian negotiators in Florida aimed at brokering an end to Russia's war in Ukraine and set the stage for key talks planned in Moscow with Russian leader Vladimir Putin. Follow the latest updates on FRANCE 24's liveblog.
items.content: A Russian drone attack killed at least one person and wounded 11 in Vyshgorod, outside of Kyiv, the regional governor said Sunday. The attack came ahead of a meeting between top Trump administration officials and Ukrainian negotiators in Florida aimed at brokering an end to Russia's war in Ukraine and set the stage for key talks planned in Moscow with Russian leader Vladimir Putin. Follow the latest updates on FRANCE 24's liveblog.

items.title: Russian attacks kill 3 in Kyiv as Ukrainian delegation travels to U.S.
items.standfirst: Russian drone and missile attacks in and around the Ukrainian capital killed at least three people early Saturday, officials said.
items.content: Russian drone and missile attacks in and around the Ukrainian capital killed at least three people early Saturday, officials said.

items.title: At least three killed in Russian drone and missile strikes on Ukraine
items.standfirst: Russian drone and missile attacks in and around the Ukraine's capital killed at least three people early Saturday, officials said. The Kyiv City Military Administration said two people were killed in the strikes on the capital, and a woman died, and eight were wounded in a combined missile and drone attack on the broader Kyiv region, according to the regional police.
items.content: Russian drone and missile attacks in and around the Ukraine's capital killed at least three people early Saturday, officials said. The Kyiv City Military Administration said two people were killed in the strikes on the capital, and a woman died, and eight were wounded in a combined missile and drone attack on the broader Kyiv region, according to the regional police.

ai_summary: Top Trump administration officials are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida.
The meeting aims to broker an end to the ongoing war in Ukraine.
Marco Rubio and Steve Witkoff are among the officials attending.
The meeting follows the resignation of Ukraine's top negotiator.
A Russian drone strike near Kyiv killed one and wounded eleven.

clusters.title: Death toll in Hong Kong housing estate fire rises to 146 as the city grieves
clusters.neutral_headline: Hong Kong Apartment Fire Death Toll Rises to 146
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Guardian World, Sky News World

items.title: Death toll in Hong Kong housing estate fire rises to 146 as the city grieves
items.standfirst: The death toll from a devastating fire at a Hong Kong apartment complex blaze rose to at least 146 on Sunday as more bodies were recovered from the charred remains of the Wang Fuk Court buildings. More than a thousand people queued near the housing complex on Sunday to pay tribute to the victims.
items.content: The death toll from a devastating fire at a Hong Kong apartment complex blaze rose to at least 146 on Sunday as more bodies were recovered from the charred remains of the Wang Fuk Court buildings. More than a thousand people queued near the housing complex on Sunday to pay tribute to the victims.

items.title: Hong Kong mourns as apartment fire death toll rises to 146
items.standfirst: Rescue teams find more bodies in burnt-out buildings of Wang Fuk Court complex after Wednesday’s fireThe death toll in Hong Kong’s apartment complex fire has risen to 146 after investigators discovered more bodies in the burnt-out buildings. A steady stream of people placed bouquets of flowers at an ever-growing makeshift memorial at the scene of the disaster, among the worst in the city’s history.The Hong Kong police’s disaster victim identification unit has been going through the buildings of the Wang Fuk Court complex meticulously and has found bodies both in apartment units and on the roofs, the officer in charge, Cheng Ka-chun, said on Sunday. Continue reading...
items.content: Rescue teams find more bodies in burnt-out buildings of Wang Fuk Court complex after Wednesday’s fireThe death toll in Hong Kong’s apartment complex fire has risen to 146 after investigators discovered more bodies in the burnt-out buildings. A steady stream of people placed bouquets of flowers at an ever-growing makeshift memorial at the scene of the disaster, among the worst in the city’s history.The Hong Kong police’s disaster victim identification unit has been going through the buildings of the Wang Fuk Court complex meticulously and has found bodies both in apartment units and on the roofs, the officer in charge, Cheng Ka-chun, said on Sunday. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: The death toll from a fire that tore through a Hong Kong apartment complex has risen.
items.content: The death toll from a fire that tore through a Hong Kong apartment complex has risen.

ai_summary: The death toll from the Hong Kong apartment fire has reached 146.
The fire occurred at the Wang Fuk Court complex.
Rescue teams are still recovering bodies from the burnt buildings.
The disaster is one of the worst in Hong Kong's history.
People are paying tribute at a makeshift memorial near the site.

The extraordinary appeal is now under review by President Isaac Herzog, whose office said the decision carries “significant implications.”
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday submitted a formal pardon request in his long-running corruption cases to the Israeli presidential office. items.title: Gaza death toll surpasses 70,000, says health ministry
items.standfirst: Two Palestinian children reportedly killed on Saturday as Israel continues its strikes after latest ceasefireThe Palestinian death toll has surpassed 70,000 since the Israel-Gaza war began, Gaza’s health ministry said on Saturday, while a hospital reported Israeli fire killed two Palestinian children in the territory’s south.The toll has continued to rise after the latest ceasefire took effect on 10 October. Israel still carries out strikes in response to what it has called violations of the truce, and bodies from earlier in the war are being recovered from the rubble. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Trump to pardon ex-Honduras president convicted of drug trafficking
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Announces Intention to Pardon Ex-Honduras President
bullet_summary: Trump said he will pardon ex-president Juan Orlando Hernandez, who was convicted last year in a US court of drug trafficking charges and sentenced to 45 years in prison
Reported by BBC World, France24, Guardian World

items.title: Trump to pardon ex-Honduras president convicted of drug trafficking
items.standfirst: Juan Orlando Hernández was sentenced in the US to 45 years behind bars for conspiring to smuggle cocaine.
items.content: Juan Orlando Hernández was sentenced in the US to 45 years behind bars for conspiring to smuggle cocaine.

items.title: Trump casts long shadow over Honduran politics ahead of vote
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Friday made a major intervention into Honduran politics days before the Central American nation votes, pardoning a convicted ex-leader and threatening to cut US support if his preferred candidate loses. Trump said he will pardon ex-president Juan Orlando Hernandez, who was convicted last year in a US court of drug trafficking charges and sentenced to 45 years in prison.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Friday made a major intervention into Honduran politics days before the Central American nation votes, pardoning a convicted ex-leader and threatening to cut US support if his preferred candidate loses. Trump said he will pardon ex-president Juan Orlando Hernandez, who was convicted last year in a US court of drug trafficking charges and sentenced to 45 years in prison.

items.title: Trump to pardon ex-Honduras leader serving drug trafficking sentence in US
items.standfirst: Hernández was convicted in 2024 of accepting millions in bribes to protect cocaine shipmentsDonald Trump has said he will grant a pardon to Juan Orlando Hernández, the former president of Honduras who is serving a 45-year prison sentence in the US on drug trafficking and weapons charges.“I will be granting a Full and Complete Pardon to Former President Juan Orlando Hernandez who has been, according to many people that I greatly respect, treated very harshly and unfairly,” Trump said on Friday in a post on Truth Social. Continue reading...
items.content: Hernández was convicted in 2024 of accepting millions in bribes to protect cocaine shipmentsDonald Trump has said he will grant a pardon to Juan Orlando Hernández, the former president of Honduras who is serving a 45-year prison sentence in the US on drug trafficking and weapons charges.“I will be granting a Full and Complete Pardon to Former President Juan Orlando Hernandez who has been, according to many people that I greatly respect, treated very harshly and unfairly,” Trump said on Friday in a post on Truth Social. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Donald Trump plans to pardon ex-Honduras President Juan Orlando Hernández.
Hernández was convicted of drug trafficking charges in the US.
He is currently serving a 45-year prison sentence.
Trump made the announcement before the Honduran election.
Trump stated Hernández was treated harshly and unfairly.

clusters.title: Death toll from Indonesia flooding rises to 417

bullet_summary: Reported by BBC World, Guardian World

items.standfirst: More than 350 people killed on Indonesia’s Sumatra island with 162 reported dead across ThailandThe death toll from devastating floods and landslides in south-east Asia reportedly climbed past 500 on Saturday as clean-up and search-and-rescue operations got under way in Indonesia, Thailand and Malaysia.Heavy monsoon rain overwhelmed swathes of the three countries this week, killing hundreds and leaving thousands stranded, many on rooftops awaiting rescue. items.title: Sri Lanka death toll from floods and landslides reaches 153
items.standfirst: Another 191 missing after heavy rains from Cyclone Ditwah while almost 78,000 evacuated to temporary shelters amid rescue operationsTorrential rains and floods triggered by Cyclone Ditwah have killed 153 people across Sri Lanka so far, with another 191 still missing, the country’s Disaster Management Centre (DCM) said on Saturday.The DMC director general, Sampath Kotuwegoda, said relief operations were under way with 78,000 people moved to nearly 800 state-run welfare centres after their homes were destroyed by the week-long heavy rains. Continue reading...

They are staple setting in films, books and plays, draw tourists to Ireland, replicate themselves around the world and induce social media quests for the perfect snug and the perfect pint.Scholars have now bestowed academic imprimatur on this cultural treasure status by examining – and celebrating – pubs through the lens of history, sociology, architecture, psychology, design, art and literature. items.title: All the president’s millions: how the Trumps are turning the presidency into riches
items.standfirst: From Vietnam to the Balkans, Donald Trump’s family has launched a global dealmaking blitz since his re-electionA crusading prosecutor in the Balkans comes under pressure to drop a big case. Vietnamese villagers learn they are to be evicted. A convicted crypto kingpin in the Gulf receives a pardon.All have one thing in common: they appear to be connected to the Trump family’s campaign to amass riches around the world. Since Donald Trump’s re-election a year ago, warnings that his use of presidential power to advance personal interests is corroding American democracy have grown ever louder. What is less understood – and perhaps even more dangerous – is the damage this is doing everywhere else. Continue reading...

items.title: Ukrainian naval drones strike two Russian oil tankers in Black Sea
items.standfirst: Kyiv tries to pile pressure on Russia with attack on empty vessels on way to load up with oil for foreign marketsUkrainian naval drones hit two tankers operating under sanctions in the Black Sea as they headed to a Russian port to load up with oil destined for foreign markets, an official said on Saturday, as Kyiv tries to pile pressure on Russia’s vast oil industry.The two oil tankers, identified as the Kairos and Virat, were empty and sailing to Novorossiysk, a major Russian Black Sea oil terminal, the official at the security service of Ukraine told Reuters. items.content: Solidarity demonstrations with Palestinians come as the death toll from Israel's war on Gaza crosses 70,000.

items.title: Tens of thousands march across Europe in show of support for Palestinians
items.standfirst: Demonstrators in several European cities, including Paris, London and Rome, took to the streets on Saturday as the UN marked the International Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People. Protesters accused Israel of violating a fragile US-brokered ceasefire and demanded tougher international action as the Gaza war death toll surged to more than 70,000.
items.content: Demonstrators in several European cities, including Paris, London and Rome, took to the streets on Saturday as the UN marked the International Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People. Protesters accused Israel of violating a fragile US-brokered ceasefire and demanded tougher international action as the Gaza war death toll surged to more than 70,000.

ai_summary: Tens of thousands rallied in Europe to show solidarity with Palestinians.
Demonstrations occurred in cities including Paris, London, and Rome.
The death toll from Israel's war on Gaza has surpassed 70,000.
Protesters accused Israel of violating a ceasefire agreement.
They demanded tougher international action regarding the conflict.

clusters.title: US small businesses sound alarm over Trump’s tariffs amid crucial holiday season
clusters.neutral_headline: US Small Businesses Concerned Over Trump Tariffs Impact
bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, Guardian Business

items.title: US small businesses sound alarm over Trump’s tariffs amid crucial holiday season
items.standfirst: Donald Trump’s tariffs have increased prices on an array of popular holiday goods and driven a “massive” number of small firms out of business, industry leaders have warned. On Small Business Saturday, firms have their fingers crossed that strong holiday sales will ease the impact of a tough year.…
items.content: Donald Trump’s tariffs have increased prices on an array of popular holiday goods and driven a “massive” number of small firms out of business, industry leaders have warned. On Small Business Saturday, firms have their fingers crossed that strong holiday sales will ease the impact of a tough year.…

items.title: US small businesses sound alarm over Trump’s tariffs amid crucial holiday season
items.standfirst: Some small business owners doubt that even strong holiday sales will ease impact of tough year plagued by uncertaintyDonald Trump’s tariffs have increased prices on an array of popular holiday goods and driven a “massive” number of small firms out of business, industry leaders have warned.On Small Business Saturday, firms have their fingers crossed that strong holiday sales will ease the impact of a tough year. But many aren’t holding their breath. Continue reading...
items.content: Some small business owners doubt that even strong holiday sales will ease impact of tough year plagued by uncertaintyDonald Trump’s tariffs have increased prices on an array of popular holiday goods and driven a “massive” number of small firms out of business, industry leaders have warned.On Small Business Saturday, firms have their fingers crossed that strong holiday sales will ease the impact of a tough year. But many aren’t holding their breath. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Small business leaders warn of Trump's tariffs' negative impact.
Tariffs have increased prices on many holiday goods.
A "massive" number of small firms have closed due to tariffs.
Some owners doubt holiday sales will offset the tough year.
The warnings were issued on Small Business Saturday.

clusters.title: Americans expected to spend over a trillion dollars for the first time this holiday season
clusters.neutral_headline: Americans Expected to Spend Over One Trillion Dollars
bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, CBS News

items.title: Americans expected to spend over a trillion dollars for the first time this holiday season
items.standfirst: Americans spent a record $12 billion online on Black Friday this year, according to Adobe Analytics. Ali Bauman reports on how rising prices are impacting shoppers.
items.content: Americans spent a record $12 billion online on Black Friday this year, according to Adobe Analytics. Ali Bauman reports on how rising prices are impacting shoppers.

items.title: Americans expected to spend over a trillion dollars for the first time this holiday season
items.standfirst: Americans spent a record $12 billion online on Black Friday this year, according to Adobe Analytics. Ali Bauman reports on how rising prices are impacting shoppers.
items.content: Americans spent a record $12 billion online on Black Friday this year, according to Adobe Analytics. Ali Bauman reports on how rising prices are impacting shoppers.

ai_summary: Americans are expected to spend over one trillion dollars this holiday season.
Online spending on Black Friday reached a record $12 billion.
Adobe Analytics provided the online spending figures.
Rising prices are impacting shoppers during the holiday season.

clusters.title: Ukrainian sea drones target Russian oil tankers
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukrainian Sea Drones Target Russian Oil Tankers
bullet_summary: Reported by NBC World, Sky News World

items.title: Ukrainian sea drones target Russian oil tankers
items.standfirst: As Ukrainian officials prepare to resume talks toward a possible peace deal, Ukrainian sea drone attacks on Russian oil tankers is raising concerns that the continued fighting could prevent a deal from being reached. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.
items.content: As Ukrainian officials prepare to resume talks toward a possible peace deal, Ukrainian sea drone attacks on Russian oil tankers is raising concerns that the continued fighting could prevent a deal from being reached. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.

items.title: Ukrainian officials head to US for talks - as Russian tankers hit by 'Sea Baby' drones
items.standfirst: Ukraine's representatives are preparing for renewed peace talks in the US, while dramatic footage has shown Russian tankers being hit by naval drones.
items.content: Ukraine's representatives are preparing for renewed peace talks in the US, while dramatic footage has shown Russian tankers being hit by naval drones.

ai_summary: Ukrainian sea drones are attacking Russian oil tankers.
The attacks are raising concerns about peace deal progress.
Ukrainian officials are preparing for renewed peace talks.
NBC News' Raf Sanchez reported on the attacks.
Dramatic footage showed Russian tankers being hit by drones.

clusters.title: Northwestern settles with Trump administration in $75M deal to regain federal funding
clusters.neutral_headline: Northwestern University Settles with Trump Administration
bullet_summary: Reported by NPR News, Guardian World

items.title: Northwestern settles with Trump administration in $75M deal to regain federal funding
items.standfirst: The university will pay $75 million over three years to end the Trump administration's investigations into antisemitism on its campus and to have millions of dollars in federal funding restored.
items.content: The university will pay $75 million over three years to end the Trump administration's investigations into antisemitism on its campus and to have millions of dollars in federal funding restored.(Image credit: Teresa Crawford)

items.title: Northwestern University agrees to pay US government $75m to restore research funding
items.standfirst: Agreement will also end series of investigations of university over school’s alleged failure to fight antisemitismNorthwestern University has agreed to pay $75m to the US government in a deal with the Trump administration to end a series of investigations and restore hundreds of millions of dollars in federal research funding.Donald Trump’s administration had cut off $790m in grants in a standoff that contributed to university layoffs and the resignation in September of Northwestern’s president, Michael Schill. The administration argued the school had not done enough to fight antisemitism. Continue reading...
items.content: Agreement will also end series of investigations of university over school’s alleged failure to fight antisemitismNorthwestern University has agreed to pay $75m to the US government in a deal with the Trump administration to end a series of investigations and restore hundreds of millions of dollars in federal research funding.Donald Trump’s administration had cut off $790m in grants in a standoff that contributed to university layoffs and the resignation in September of Northwestern’s president, Michael Schill. The administration argued the school had not done enough to fight antisemitism. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Northwestern will pay $75 million over three years.
The settlement ends investigations into campus antisemitism.
The university will regain millions in federal funding.
The Trump administration had cut off $790 million in grants.
The administration argued the school did not fight antisemitism.

clusters.title: Pope Leo visits Blue Mosque in Turkiye’s Istanbul
clusters.neutral_headline: Pope Leo Visits Istanbul's Blue Mosque
bullet_summary: Reported by Al Jazeera, BBC World

items.title: Pope Leo visits Blue Mosque in Turkiye’s Istanbul
items.standfirst: The pope is visiting Turkiye until Sunday on his first overseas trip as pontiff, which also includes a visit to Lebanon.
items.content: The pope is visiting Turkiye until Sunday on his first overseas trip as pontiff, which also includes a visit to Lebanon.

items.title: Pope Leo visits Istanbul's Blue Mosque
items.standfirst: It is the first time Leo has attended a Muslim place of worship since he took up the papacy in May.
items.content: It is the first time Leo has attended a Muslim place of worship since he took up the papacy in May.

ai_summary: Pope Leo is visiting Turkiye until Sunday.
This is his first overseas trip as pontiff.
The trip includes a visit to Lebanon.
He visited Istanbul's Blue Mosque.
It is his first visit to a Muslim place of worship.
